siteMetadata.description: The personal internet domicile of Simon E√ülinger

node.html:
Hello world! I'm Simon and this is my personal tiny site on the internet.

I enjoy programming (working with C#, JS, Azure, CI/CD-Systems amongst others), selfhosting stuff on my Linux servers, competitive games and traveling the world the minimalist digital native way. Oh, and I love Markdown, in fact this page was actually written in Markdown. üòÅ Also, stop social cooling!

Currently I'm working towards becoming a proper DevOps / Backend Engineer.

Professional work

  • Software Developer at tapio GmbH [2020/10 - today]

  • Business Information Systems Dual Student at HOMAG GmbH [2017/10 - 2020/09]

    • The dual study program is a special german thing where you alternate between working and studying. During the practical phases I had the opportunity to work in different roles in associated companies.
    • At tapio I was part of a Scrum development team working on the tapio backend, learning a lot about Azure, .NET, the DevOps approach and agile principles.
    • At HOMAG Machinery Shanghai I documented the current process landscape in preparation for the rollout of a new IT-system and had a great time living in Shanghai City for 4 months!
    • Finally, I was also able to represent HOMAG at the hackathons #hackthewood in Berlin and ADAMOS Hackathon 4.5 in Schwertberg, Austria.

  • Paramedic (Rettungssanit√§ter) at DRK-KV Freudenstadt e.V. [2015/09 - 2017/09]

    • After graduating from high school I decided to take on a voluntary social year as rescue worker (Rettungshelfer). My main duty was to assist the transportation of non-critical patients. Because I also wanted to work in emergency rescue I completed the training to be a paramedic (Rettungssanit√§ter) in my spare time and spent another 12 months actually rescuing people!

Education

  • Business Information Systems (B.Sc.) at DHBW Villingen-Schwenningen [2017/10 - 2020/09]
